headline: Elementary thinking
text: Sherlock Holmes would have agreed with Richard Lee about the importance of school buildings (Letters, 3 October). Returning by train from Portsmouth in The Naval Treaty, he is silent and deep in thought until leaving Clapham Junction, when he sees ER Robson's new board schools. Suddenly animated, he encourages Watson to look at them, saying: "Lighthouses, my boy! Beacons of the future! Capsules, with hundreds of bright little seeds in each, out of which will spring the wiser, better England of the future." The schools are still there, of course, but will that be the case with Gove's new academies in 100 years or so?Victor BurgessLondon  Ironic, isn't it, that the government is planning to make school buildings smaller, while ensuring that pupils get bigger (Junk food banned in maintained schools is being sold in academies, 10 September)? Is this joined-up policymaking?Nigel GannChiselborough, Somerset
